greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = difference between n and the n-th Catalan restricted growth string [b_k, b_{k-1}, ..., b_2, b_1] (see A239903) when it is viewed as a simple numeral in Catalan Base: b_k*C(k) + b_{k-1}*C(k-1) + ... + b_2*C(2) +b_1*C(1). Here C(m) = A000108(m).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16796
formula: a(n) = n - A244158(A239903(n)) up to 58784, after which the "digits" in Catalan restricted growth strings grow larger than 9 and their decimal representation used in A239903 starts corrupting the results.
Use the Scheme-program given in the Program sections of this entry and A239903 (the function A239903raw) to get correct results for all n.
program: (define (A244157 n) (- n (CatBaseSum (A239903raw n)))) ;; A239903raw given in A239903.
(define (CatBaseSum lista) (let loop ((digits (reverse lista)) (i 1) (s 0)) (if (null? digits) s (loop (cdr digits) (+ i 1) (+ s (* (car digits) (A000108 i)))))))
xref: A244155 gives the positions of zeros, A244156 the positions of nonzeros.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 22 2014
